stem: A 24-year-old man who has been discharged following admission for a spontaneous pneumothorax asks for advice about flying. During his stay in the hospital, the pneumothorax was aspirated and a check x-ray revealed no residual air. What is the earliest time he should fly?
disc: According to the Civil Aviation Authority (CAA), pneumothorax is an absolute contraindication for air travel. Patients may travel after 2 weeks from successful drainage and if there is no residual air.
